greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Number of partitions of n into squarefree divisors of n.
link: Reinhard Zumkeller and Alois P. Heinz, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..10000 (300 terms from Reinhard Zumkeller)
formula: a(n) = [x^n] Product_{d|n, mu(d) != 0} 1/(1 - x^d), where mu() is the Moebius function (A008683). - _Ilya Gutkovskiy_, Jul 26 2017
maple: a:= proc(n) local b, l; l:= sort([select(issqrfree, divisors(n))[]]):
b:= proc(m, i) option remember; `if`(m=0 or i=1, 1,
mathematica: a[0] = 1; a[n_] := Module[{b, l}, l = Select[Divisors[n], SquareFreeQ]; b[m_, i_] := b[m, i] = If[m == 0 || i == 1, 1, If[i < 1, 0, b[m, i - 1] + If[l[[i]] > m, 0, b[m - l[[i]], i]]]]; b[n, Length[l]]]; Table[a[n], {n, 0, 100}] (* _Jean-François Alcover_, Oct 27 2015, after _Alois P. Heinz_ *)
program: a225244 n = p (a206778_row n) n where
p ks'@(k:ks) m = if m < k then 0 else p ks' (m - k) + p ks m
results.author: _Reinhard Zumkeller_, May 05 2013
